Articles.Content:
Hi,

So, as luck would have it, a small bug went by unnoticed in the 0.11 update. It would prevent time from resuming after unpausing the game, unless you cycled the time warp rates to get it moving again.

To fix that, there is a 0.11.1 hotfix update, which is now available for download.

Cheers
Just restarted after fiddling with some of my custom parts and saw it. I had the bug happen once and that was a little strange. Thanks for the quick fix.

Well the warping also affects your orbits, I\'ve noticed going back to 1x after being past 10x warp, it makes your eccentricity increase by nearly 1,000 meters every time. (Decreasing the peroapsis and increasing apoapsis). It also stuffs up the G-Force readings.

Could you also fix the orbit problem with time warp for a future update?
I\'m suspecting that time warping does not increase the update rate of the physics engine, which will obviously screw things up... I hope they\'re planning to fix that.

There is no physics when you warp past 2x. You\'re on rails.

HarvesteR, I had that issue last night where at high warp at great distance, the game won\'t allow you to un-warp in order to make any changes to your orbit.

Seems to consistently happen every time I head way out there.
Also, you can\'t name rocket saves in this version, so you can only save 1 rocket (as Untitled). That needs fixing fast!

Also, you can\'t name rocket saves in this version, so you can only save 1 rocket (as Untitled). That needs fixing fast!

I\'ve not had any problems changing the name of my rockets.

What OS are you using?

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky
??? now to wait for 0.12 to drop, any word on release dates?

'When it\'s ready'.

The best place to look for news is in the development forum, especially the 'KSP 0.12 features thread'.
